intro: Synclisia junodii, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn red when mature. Synclisia junodii is often found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar.
